intro: Doria inornata, commonly known as the plain doria, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, unbranched stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically ovate in shape. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, with five petals and a distinct tubular corolla. Doria inornata is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and undergrowth areas.
